page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: This block is located in the Highlands of Scotland - in Easter Ross. It lies on the coastal lowlands between the Cromarty Firth and the hills of the North west Highlands to the north. The A9 (the main road through the Highlands which runs WSW - ENE through the area) divides the area into two unequal parts. There is no central settlement though a nucleus is developing at Newmore due to recent private building. However two of the four major towns in Easter Ross are close by - Invergordon 2km. to the south,Alness 3km. to the west. The area is essentially an agricultural area but industry exists in Forestry and quarrying; and the now closed aluminium smelter. 3 buildings dominate the area:Rosskeen Church,Kincraig House and the smelter.
